meanings.definition: A type of corduroy fabric with a distinct raised rib pattern.
meanings.sent1: The tailor used pinwales to make a warm jacket.
meanings.sent2: I love the soft feel of pinwales on my new pants.
meanings.sent3: The fashion designer joked that only pinwales could make corduroy cool again.
meanings.sent4: Her smile created pinwales of happiness on his face.
meanings.sent5: The sunlight danced on the pinwales of the fabric, creating a beautiful shimmer.

meanings.definition: The ridges or raised lines on the fabric of corduroy pants.
meanings.sent1: She admired the intricate pinwales on her favorite trousers.
meanings.sent2: The pinwales on his jacket added a stylish touch to his outfit.
meanings.sent3: The cat's claws left tiny pinwales on the corduroy couch.
meanings.sent4: The music notes formed pinwales of sound in the air.
meanings.sent5: The artist carefully painted the pinwales of the fabric to capture its texture.

meanings.definition: To create a pinwale pattern on fabric.
meanings.sent1: She decided to pinwale the cloth to give it a unique look.
meanings.sent2: The designer will pinwale the material for the upcoming collection.
meanings.sent3: He accidentally pinwaled his shirt while trying a new sewing technique.
meanings.sent4: The artist's brush seemed to pinwale the canvas with each stroke.
meanings.sent5: The tailor skillfully pinwales the fabric, adding depth to the texture.
